532 Gallery Jaeckel
JOHN ALEXANDER PARKS:
Dancers With Islands, 2024
Oil on canvas
20.32 × 25.4 cm
PURCHASE / INQUIRE
$5000
Shipping quote on request. Local pickup available.
About the artwork:

Finger-painted dancers whirl amid island forms, capturing playful human gestures in a narrative scene that blends memory and invention, evoking joy through Parks’ rich, evocative surfaces. Framed dimensions: 23 × 30.5 cm.

About the artist:

John Alexander Parks’ finger-painted narratives explore human gestures and interactions through playful, putti-inspired scenes executed from memory. His works blend childish methods with mature themes, creating rich surfaces that evoke the stuff of memory and universal behaviors.

John A. Parks was born in 1952 in Leeds, England, and lives and works in New York. He received his MA in Painting from the Royal College of Art, London (1976), and BA in Fine Art from Hull College of Art (1973).

Parks has had solo exhibitions widely in the US and England over thirty years. He has participated in recent group exhibitions with works in collections like the Victoria and Albert Museum, London, and the Museum of the Rhode Island School of Design.

View Full Artist Profile
